subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text:
"To pass over" > "to offend against, oppose". Compare {{zh-l|*氾}}.

This character originally had bilabial nasal (*-''m'') final in Old and Middle Chinese, but had undergone [[dissimilation]] (from bilabial plosive *''b''-) to become *-''n'' in most dialects, except for Hakka. Similar dissimilation happened in {{zh-l|*帆}}.
